text: hey folks - been looking at a series of PRs for "COP" (aka membership services for v1).  Granted they are failing current CI (easy fix for that) but I think at this point it definitely makes sense to create a separate repo for COP and then get the initial set of code checked in there

<@U0KM61BCP> <@U0PB67X4K> wrt to the above 2 comments, the work started in <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1633/> (Pared down Peer) could be a starting point for the reorg ? And at some point (or in parallel) we can cherry pick commits from master and move them into convergence ?

everybody: as you know I have this commit chain: <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/941/>
it is a little bit inconsistent now as it reflects two different ideas (inconsistent = code not rebased because it needs manual merge). which do you prefer?
1) have an error handling 'framework' similar to the current way of error handling where one can create his/her own error using Errorf("anything") (errors.Errorf instead of fmt.Errorf)
2) have one that supports multiple languages but with predefined errors read from a json file where there is a mapping of ERROR_CODEs, languages and error messages
Please tell me what you think.
